opening.title: Jellyfish Blooms Are Costing You Millions
opening.text: Massive jellyfish blooms force emergency shutdowns at power stations, desalination plants, and cooling systems worldwide, costing facilities $800K to $2.5M per incident. Traditional solutions (chemical treatments, mechanical screens, manual removal) are expensive, environmentally harmful, and show limited effectiveness.

promise.title: Nature-Inspired Protection Technology
promise.text: JellyGuard is a biomimetic approach designed to guide jellyfish away from intake zones using natural behavior patterns, concentrating them in a safe surface layer for harmless removal (no chemicals, grinding, or ecosystem disruption).

steps.title: Four Steps to Complete Protection
descriptions: Integrated sensors detect bloom arrival and water flow patterns.
Passive biomimetic guides redirect organisms away from critical zones.
Remaining organisms are concentrated in a controlled surface layer.
Automated or manual removal from safe collection zone without harm.

faq.title: Everything You Need to Know
faq.subtitle: Get answers to the most common questions about JellyGuard

items.question: What intake sizes can JellyGuard protect?
items.answer: JellyGuard scales from 0.5m to 15m diameter intakes. Systems are modular and can protect flow rates from 5,000 m³/hr to 500,000 m³/hr. For larger facilities, multiple units work in parallel.

items.question: What power requirements does the system need?
items.answer: Minimal. Standard systems draw 2-8 kW depending on size - 95% less than mechanical screening alternatives. Solar-compatible for remote installations.

items.question: Does it work in all water conditions?
items.answer: Yes. Tested in temperatures 4°C-32°C, salinity 10-40 PSU, and flow velocities 0.3-2.5 m/s. Handles mixed species blooms (jellyfish, salps, ctenophores).

items.question: What materials are used?
items.answer: Marine-grade aluminum frames, HDPE panels, stainless steel fasteners. All non-toxic, corrosion-resistant, designed for 15+ year lifespan in harsh marine environments.

items.question: How is it different from physical screens?
items.answer: Screens trap and kill organisms, require constant cleaning, and create intake blockages. JellyGuard guides organisms away using natural behavior - no contact, no damage, no clogging.

items.question: How long does installation take?
items.answer: Site assessment: 2-3 days. System design: 2-4 weeks. Installation: 5-12 days depending on size. Full commissioning and training: 2 days. Most facilities operational within 8 weeks.

items.question: Can it be installed without shutting down operations?
items.answer: Yes. Modular design allows phased installation during normal maintenance windows. No full shutdown required for most configurations.

items.question: What certifications do installers need?
items.answer: Our certified team handles installation. Local dive team support may be required. We provide full training for your maintenance staff post-installation.

items.question: Is retrofitting existing intakes possible?
items.answer: Absolutely. 85% of installations are retrofits. Works with any intake type: vertical wells, horizontal pipes, culverts, cooling channels. Custom design for each site.

items.question: What is the typical ROI timeline?
items.answer: 18-36 months depending on facility size and current downtime costs. Mediterranean desalination plant achieved ROI in 14 months through eliminated emergency cleanings.

items.question: What is the total cost of ownership vs. alternatives?
items.answer: 5-year TCO is 60% lower than mechanical screening, 75% lower than chemical treatment. No consumables, minimal energy costs, 2-3 service visits per year.

items.question: Are there leasing or financing options?
items.answer: Yes. Full purchase, 3/5-year leases, or performance-based contracts (pay per uptime hour). Flexible terms for municipal and private operators.

items.question: What ongoing costs should we expect?
items.answer: Annual maintenance: $12K-$45K depending on size. Includes 2-3 service visits, remote monitoring, parts replacement. Energy costs: $2K-$8K/year.

items.question: What is the system efficacy rate?
items.answer: 95-98% bloom prevention in field deployments. Independent validation by marine research institutes. Maintains 90%+ efficacy during extreme bloom events (>100 organisms/m³).

items.question: How quickly does it respond to bloom arrivals?
items.answer: Instant. Passive system is always active. Integrated sensors detect blooms 6-12 hours before intake arrival, allowing operational adjustments.

items.question: What happens during maintenance periods?
items.answer: System remains operational during routine checks. Critical maintenance scheduled during low-bloom seasons. Redundant modules allow partial system maintenance without shutdown.

items.question: Is there a performance guarantee?
items.answer: Yes. We guarantee 90% reduction in jellyfish-related downtime or full refund within first year. Performance bond available for large installations.
